Date: 2025-12-02 21:00 Local Reported: 2025-12-03 12:53 Pacific Duration: 3ish minutes No of observers: 1 Location: Seattle, WA, USA Location details: In my living room looking out the north facing windows towards downtown Seattle Shape: Orb Color: White or blue Estimated Size: Larger than a helicopter Viewed From: Land Direction from Viewer: Facing north Angle of Elevation: 45 Closest Distance: Maybe a mile or two Estimated Speed: Slow to extremely fast Explanation: Searchlight - Possible Characteristics: Lights on object, Aura or haze around object Something zipped past the clouds outside my windows which drew my attention. Three more were moving around then took off I was sitting in my living room in Beacon Hill, just outside downtown Seattle, facing west and watching television. The blinds on the north-facing window were completely open. Suddenly, something very bright and fast zipped through the overcast clouds from west to east, right at the point where the roofline of my house meets the sky. This caught my attention and caused me to turn and look. Further north, I noticed three lights in the sky. At first, I dismissed them as spotlights, but I kept glancing back because their movement was unusual. The lights would separate, then come back together. Occasionally, one would zip away and then return. They moved in circles, traveled side by side, peeled off in different directions, and at times moved in a distinct zig-zag pattern. What prompted me to get up and move closer to the window was the realization that each of the lights had a bright white ball at its center—something not typical of spotlights. Additionally, when the lights moved through the clouds and separated, they did not diffuse or angle outward the way a normal spotlight beam would. I turned off the lights in the room to get a better look. When I returned with my camera, the lights were gone. I waited to see if they would reappear, but they did not. The north-facing window looks directly onto the flight path for aircraft approaching Seattle–Tacoma International Airport. Whatever these lights were, they appeared to be flying just above the cloud layer. I’ve watched every type of airplane and helicopter imaginable pass by this window, and none of them have ever looked or behaved like what I observed tonight. Posted 2025-12-05
